questions.text: What prominent politician was nearly assassinated?
questions.explanation:
U.S. President

	The president was in National City to announce support for a law to give aliens the same rights as Earth-born citizens. She insisted on a meeting with Supergirl. The president was played by Lynda Carter, who is famous for playing Wonder Woman in the old TV series of the same name.

questions.text: Who started giving out orders to reporters, despite not being in charge?
questions.explanation:
Snapper Car.

	James Olsen took over running the company with Cat on leave, but Snapper overpowered him in the first meeting and started giving out all of the assignments. Snapper was the newly hired head of investigative reporting.

questions.text: Who was the first person Kara interviewed as a reporter?
questions.explanation:
Lena Luthor.

	She was the sister of Earth's most notorious alien hater, Lex Luthor. Lena tried to get Kara to try a new device that would identify non-humans during the interview.

questions.text: Where was the alien that escaped from the DEO from?
questions.explanation:
Daxom.

	He escaped from the DEO in the opening scene of the episode. When he was tracked down, his only goal was to go home. At first he was believed to be a Kryptonian based on the powers he used.

questions.text: Kara's first article made the front page of the CatCo. Magazine.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Snapper read parts of it to her and complained that she had infused it with her opinion. He forced her to rewrite the article without her own opinions mixed in.

questions.text: A local police detective took Alex to a safe haven for aliens in National City. Where was it?
questions.explanation:
A bar.

	The detective had been a thorn in Alex's side the entire episode, insisting on working the investigation of the assassination attempt. By midway through the episode they were working together to find the would-be assassin.

questions.text: Daxom is the sister planet to Krypton.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Daxom was a monarchy whereas Krypton was a democracy. Their inhabitants had the same powers on Earth because their planets orbited the same sun and they evolved from the same things. Kara described their planets like the Hatfields and the McCoys on Earth.

questions.text: Who was kidnapped by the assassin?
questions.explanation:
Maggie Sawyer.

	Maggie was the local detective that was working to find the assassin. She was taken during the second attack on the president. The assassin wanted to kill the president because she felt it the amnesty law was about registration, not acceptance.

questions.text: Why was Snapper upset near the end of the episode?
options: Kara was given a job working under him, despite his objections.
It wasn't revealed in this episode.
questions.explanation:
James had rewritten his article.

	James rewrote the lede on Snapper's article. Snapper stormed into the newsroom and demanded that James didn't have the right to do so. After an argument they agreed to stay out of each other's job duties.

questions.text: What was the name of the alien Supergirl had first thought was the assassin?
questions.explanation:
Mon-El.

	Near the end of the episode she told him that Daxom was destroyed when Krypton blew up. Parts of her planet had struck his and knocked it out of orbit. The planet was still there, but was uninhabitable.
